ThingDef.label: Browning Side-by-Side
ThingDef.description: A double-barrelled hunting shotgun, able to fire two quick bursts of 12 gauge.

ThingDef.label: Stoeger Coach Gun
ThingDef.description: A lightweight, somewhat compact double-barrelled shotgun.

ThingDef.label: Chiappa Triple Threat
ThingDef.description: An exotic triple-barrelled shotgun, specifically designed for defensive use.

ThingDef.label: Chiappa Triple Threat (sawed-off)
ThingDef.description: An exotic triple-barrelled shotgun, specifically designed for defensive use. This one has had its barrels shortened and stock removed.

ThingDef.label: Savage 42 Takedown
ThingDef.description: A lightweight survival gun, capable of firing .22 lr rounds in the top barrel and .410 bore shells in the bottom. Can be easily disassembled with the push of a button, allowing it to be easily transported anywhere in a very small package.

ThingDef.label: improvised shotgun
ThingDef.description: A very simple slam-fire 12 gauge shotgun which consists of two metal tubes connected to a stock. Much less accurate than a properly machined shotgun, but very easy to produce.\n\nAn unintentional upside to its construction is that it can be easily disassembled into a more compact form, by simply pulling the barrel off.

ThingDef.label: Mossberg Maverick 88
ThingDef.description: A lightweight polymer-framed pump shotgun which features a decent ammo capacity.

ThingDef.label: Mossberg 590 Thunder Ranch
ThingDef.description: A lightweight polymer-framed pump shotgun which features a decent ammo capacity.

ThingDef.label: Mossberg 590A1
ThingDef.description: A polymer-framed pump-action shotgun that emits a tight-packed spray of pellets. Deadly, but short range.

ThingDef.label: Mossberg 590A1 Retrograde
ThingDef.description: A pump-action shotgun designed to resemble its earliest predecessors but with modern features.

ThingDef.label: Mossberg 590A1 Class III
ThingDef.description: A short-barrel version of the M590A1 shotgun, designed for very tight spaces.

ThingDef.label: Remington M870 Fieldmaster
ThingDef.description: A simple pump-action hunting shotgun with a long barrel for a tighter spread. Very lethal in close-quarters.

ThingDef.label: Remington M870 Fieldmaster (sawed-off)
ThingDef.description: A simple pump-action hunting shotgun which has had both its barrel and stock cut down to decrease weight and bulk.

ThingDef.label: Remington M870 FR Cantilever
ThingDef.description: A pump-action shotgun fitted with a scope and a rifled barrel. Clearly intended to be used with slugs, it is effective out to 150 meters.

ThingDef.label: Remington M870 Tactical
ThingDef.description: A polymer-framed pump-action shotgun. Features a retractable stock to make it more compact.

ThingDef.label: Remington M870 Home Defense
ThingDef.description: A typical pump-action shotgun. Ideal for close-quarters combat.

ThingDef.label: TACORD M870 Operator
ThingDef.description: A customized pump-action shotgun. Features a red-dot sight.

ThingDef.label: Remington Tac-14
ThingDef.description: A compact pump-action shotgun. Designed to be manueverable in close-quarters, but rather ineffective anywhere else.

ThingDef.label: Browning Pump Shotgun 10 Field
ThingDef.description: A large and heavy shotgun chambered for 10 gauge shells. Very powerful, but quite unwieldy.

ThingDef.label: Browning Pump Shotgun 10 Field (sawed-off)
ThingDef.description: A heavy pump-action shotgun chambered for 10 gauge shells. Its barrel has been cut down to a shorter length to improve its close-quarters combat capabilities, though it sacrifices some range and accuracy.

ThingDef.label: SPAS-12
ThingDef.description: A heavy semi-automatic combat shotgun, designed to terrify enemies with its brutal appearance. Popular, but rare to see in use.

ThingDef.label: SPAS-12 Sport
ThingDef.description: The even more rare "sporting" version of the classic SPAS-12 shotgun, which features a fixed stock and smaller magazine tube.

ThingDef.label: SPAS-12 (Stockless)
ThingDef.description: A heavy semi-automatic combat shotgun, designed to terrify enemies with its brutal appearance. Popular, but rare to see in use.

ThingDef.label: Remington Model SP-10
ThingDef.description: A large semi-automatic 10 gauge shotgun. Very powerful, but heavy.\n\nOriginal SP-10 models featured a recoil mitigation system which consequently limited the magazine tube to two shells, but this one has had it removed.

ThingDef.label: Remington Model SP-10 custom
ThingDef.description: A large semi-automatic 10 gauge shotgun. Very powerful, but heavy. This one has been modified to use a larger magazine tube, as well as fit a laser and red dot sight. Its ported barrel reduces recoil.

ThingDef.label: Benelli M1014
ThingDef.description: A semi-automatic combat shotgun, it fires quickly between shots. Very lethal in close-quarters.

ThingDef.label: Browning Auto-5 Hunter
ThingDef.description: An autoloading shotgun ready for hunting.

ThingDef.label: Browning Auto-5 Hunter (sawed-off)
ThingDef.description: An autoloading shotgun ready for hunting. Its barrel has been cut down to a shorter length to improve its close-quarters combat capabilities, though it sacrifices some range and accuracy.

ThingDef.label: Savage Renegauge Security
ThingDef.description: A lightweight semi-automatic shotgun, it fires quickly between shots. very lethal in close-quarters.

ThingDef.label: Savage Renegauge Competition
ThingDef.description: A semi-automatic competition shotgun with a very large magazine tube. More accurate than most other shotguns due to its longer barrel.

ThingDef.label: Savage 220 XP
ThingDef.description: A bolt-action hunting shotgun with a two round magazine. With a rifled barrel and a scope, it is clearly intended to be loaded with slugs.

ThingDef.label: REV410
ThingDef.description: A simple revolver shotgun, chambered for .410 bore ammunition. It is mainly intended for pest control and hunting small animals.

ThingDef.label: AA-12
ThingDef.description: An extremely rare magazine-fed fully automatic combat shotgun. It is extraordinarily dangerous compared to most other shotguns, but is quite unwieldy.
